column4: I'm fed up with this. Why does sound work perfectly in a DSL  distribution from 2004 but Ubuntu 10.04 crackles and pops and cliks??
ive seen some issues with sound card/power saver features causing pops and noises when the card is woken up.
This is constans, regular popping
constant*
check the forums and bug reports for your exact chipset see if any one has some potential fixs perjhaps.
All I've found is people saying sound works perfectly out of the box. Now I've tried installing Open Sound System and I get no sound at all, the player just skips to the next track on the playlist
when you do things like that. theres often no magic simple fix.
fire up package manager , remove what ever oss stuff you installed.. reinstall alsa.
I did everything from the command line according to https://help.ubuntu.com/community/OpenSound ... Now it jsut skips to the next file every time I try playing an mp3
So saying jsut uninstall is tricky for me when I don't have instructions to follow
You could always try  the next release. see if sound works in the alpha. if not file a bug report. perhas it will get fixed befor the next release is finalized.
I can't install anything newer than 10.04 because the new installer won't work
you filed a but on the installer not working?
No, I've never filed a bug...don't know how
what OSS did you install exactly?
I followed https://help.ubuntu.com/community/OpenSound
I only installed OSS because I thought it might help me get rid of the crackling noise
youmay want to try updaeting the alsa drivers/system.
First, though, Gstreamer codecs are the ones I want, right?
Huh? I always install ubuntu-restrict3ed-extras
Oh ok I'll try that
